clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Rehabilitation in Gait Recovery After Knee or Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Rehabilitation in Gait Recovery After Knee or Hip Arthroplasty: a Pilot Observational Study Based on Kinematic and Kinetic Parameters

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of rehabilitation on gait recovery in subjects after knee or hip arthroplasty. Assessment is performed the day after admission (T0) and the day of discharge (T1), in a post-acute rehabilitation hospital, through an optoelectronic system (BTS DX-400). Other functional scales are administered to the subjects. during the rehabilitation period, subjects received conventional physiotherapy.

arm_group.description: Subjects that received knee arthroplasty 2-3 days before admission to undergo a rehabilitation period in our rehabilitation hospital.
Subjects that received hip arthroplasty 2-3 days before admission to undergo a rehabilitation period in our rehabilitation hospital.
Subjects age-matched with those included in the knee and hip group. Subjects are asked to walk at their self-selected speed and at low speed matchable with those of the knee and hip group

intervention.description: The subjects will receive rehabilitation according to the guidelines on the management of subjects after knee or hip arthroplasty, recovery of joint Range of Motion, recovery of lower limb strength, education to the crutches management, and stairs climbing and descending

study_pop.textblock: In this study, we included subjects who underwent in the previous 3/4 days for knee or hip arthroplasty subjects, before admission to our post-acute rehabilitation hospital, where they receive conventional physiotherapy.
